DOC.HEADLINE: NATION IN BRIEF ; NATIONWIDE ; BLACKS ' LUNG_CANCER SUSCEPTIBILITY CITED
DOC.TEXT: Blacks may be biologically more likely than whites to develop lung_cancer from smoking , according to a study released at a cancer conference in San Francisco . The results are particularly relevant because cigarette manufacturers have been accused of aggressively targeting blacks in their marketing campaigns , said John Richie of the American Health Foundation , which conducted the study . " Our initial data seem to indicate that blacks have a poorer capacity than whites to detoxify NNK , one of the most important tobacco-related carcinogens linked to lung_cancer , " Richie told a meeting of the American Assn . for Cancer Research .
